transcripts.text: Good afternoon, friends.  Steve Benoon here with Israeli News Live.  And the situation, of course, today that unfolded in the capital just is unbelievable.  But now let me just clarify, though.  I can... believe that the agitators that stormed the Capitol, it just doesn't appear to be like that of normal pro-Trump supporters.  In fact, there was an article that we picked up on.  Let me see if I can find it right.  Here we go, right here.  Facial recognition of.  We'll kind of pause this because there's all kinds of language that goes off in the background of that.  Firm claims Antifa infiltrated Trump's protesters who stormed the Capitol.  Said retired military officer told the Washington Times that the firm XR Vision used its software to do a facial recognition of protesters and matched two Philadelphia Antifa members to two men inside the Senate.  The source provided the photo matches to the Times.  One has a tattoo that indicates he is a Stalinist sympathizer and deeper promotes anarchy through violence and wants the end of America in favor of.
